verses.text: Moreover he made an altar of brass , twenty cubits the length thereof, and twenty cubits the breadth thereof, and ten cubits the height thereof. \p

¶ Also he made a molten sea of ten cubits from brim to brim , round in compass , and five cubits the height thereof; and a line of thirty cubits did compass it round about.\f + \fr 4.2 \ft from…: Heb. from his brim to his brim\f*
And under it \add was\add* the similitude of oxen , which did compass it round about : ten in a cubit , compassing the sea round about. Two rows of oxen \add were\add* cast , when it was cast.

It stood upon twelve oxen , three looking toward the north , and three looking toward the west , and three looking toward the south , and three looking toward the east : and the sea \add was set\add* above upon them, and all their hinder parts \add were\add* inward.

And the thickness of it \add was\add* an handbreadth , and the brim of it like the work of the brim of a cup , with flowers of lilies ; \add and\add* it received and held three thousand baths.\f + \fr 4.5 \ft with flowers…: or, like a lilyflower\f* \p

¶ He made also ten lavers , and put five on the right hand , and five on the left , to wash in them: such things as they offered for the burnt offering they washed in them; but the sea \add was\add* for the priests to wash in.\f + \fr 4.6 \ft such…: Heb. the work of burnt offering\f*
And he made ten candlesticks of gold according to their form , and set \add them\add* in the temple , five on the right hand , and five on the left.
He made also ten tables , and placed \add them\add* in the temple , five on the right side , and five on the left. And he made an hundred basons of gold.\f + \fr 4.8 \ft basons: or, bowls\f* \p
¶ Furthermore he made the court of the priests , and the great court , and doors for the court , and overlaid the doors of them with brass.
And he set the sea on the right side of the east end , over against the south. \p

And Huram made the pots , and the shovels , and the basons. And Huram finished the work that he was to make for king Solomon for the house of God ;\f + \fr 4.11 \ft basons: or, bowls\f*\f + \fr 4.11 \ft finished: Heb. finished to make\f*

\add To wit\add*, the two pillars , and the pommels , and the chapiters \add which were\add* on the top of the two pillars , and the two wreaths to cover the two pommels of the chapiters which \add were\add* on the top of the pillars ;

And four hundred pomegranates on the two wreaths ; two rows of pomegranates on each wreath , to cover the two pommels of the chapiters which \add were\add* upon the pillars.\f + \fr 4.13 \ft upon: Heb. upon the face of\f*
He made also bases , and lavers made he upon the bases ;\f + \fr 4.14 \ft lavers: or, caldrons\f*
One sea , and twelve oxen under it.

The pots also, and the shovels , and the fleshhooks , and all their instruments , did Huram his father make to king Solomon for the house of the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* of bright brass.\f + \fr 4.16 \ft bright: Heb. made bright, or, scoured\f*
In the plain of Jordan did the king cast them, in the clay ground between Succoth and Zeredathah.\f + \fr 4.17 \ft clay…: Heb. thicknesses of the ground\f*
Thus Solomon made all these vessels in great abundance : for the weight of the brass could not be found out. \p
¶ And Solomon made all the vessels that \add were for\add* the house of God , the golden altar also, and the tables whereon the shewbread \add was set;\add*
Moreover the candlesticks with their lamps , that they should burn after the manner before the oracle , of pure gold ;
And the flowers , and the lamps , and the tongs , \add made he of\add* gold , \add and\add* that perfect gold ;\f + \fr 4.21 \ft perfect…: Heb. perfections of gold\f*

And the snuffers , and the basons , and the spoons , and the censers , \add of\add* pure gold : and the entry of the house , the inner doors thereof for the most holy \add place\add*, and the doors of the house of the temple , \add were of\add* gold.\f + \fr 4.22 \ft basons: or, bowls\f*
